name: age_8_11
label: School-aged children 8-11
definition: 8-11 year-olds as a percentage of the total population
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 Census Cat. no. 98-311-XCB2011023, 98-311-XCB2011019

name: age_12_19
label: School-aged children 12-19
definition: 12-19 year-olds as a percentage of the total population
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 Census Cat. no. 98-311-XCB2011023, 98-311-XCB2011019

name: households_in_subsidised_housing
label: Households in subsidised housing
definition: Households living in subsidized housing as a percentage of all households
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Cat. no. 99-004-XWE

name: recent_immigrants
label: Recent immigrants
definition: Percentage of the population that arrived in Canada within the past 5 years
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Cat. no. 99-004-XWE

name: no_knowledge_of_official_languages
label: Population with no knowledge of English or French
definition: Population with no knowledge of either French or English as a percentage of the total population
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 Census Cat. no. 98-311-XCB201106, 98-314-XCB2011010

name: low_income_population
label: Low-income population
definition: Population living below the after-tax Low-income measure (LIM-AT) as a percentage of the total population
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Cat. no. 99-004-XWE

name: aboriginal_population
label: Aboriginal population
definition: Percentage of the population that self-identifies as Aboriginal
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Cat. no. 99-004-XWE

name: educational_disadvantage_aged_20_24
label: Educational disadvantage (youth)
definition: Percentage of the population aged 20-24 that does not have a high school diploma or any other certificate or diploma
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Custom Tabulation

name: educational_assets_aged_20_34
label: Educational Assets (youth)
definition: Percentage of the population aged 20-34 that has completed a postsecondary certificate, diploma or degree
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Custom Tabulation

name: educational_assets_aged_35_64
label: Educational Assets (adults)
definition: Percentage of the population aged 35-64 year that has completed a postsecondary certificate, diploma or degree
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Custom Tabulation

name: youth_unemployment_aged_20_34
label: Youth Unemployment
definition: Percentage of the labour force aged 20-34 that is unemployed
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Custom Tabulation

name: adult_unemployment_aged_35_64
label: Adult Unemployment
definition: Percentage of the labour force aged 35-64 that is unemployed
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Custom Tabulation

name: aboriginal_youth_aged_15_24
label: Aboriginal youth
definition: Percentage of the population aged 15-24 that self-identifies as Aboriginal
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Target Group Profile; 2011 Census Cat. no. 98-311-XCB2011023, 98-311-XCB2011019

name: immigrant_youth_aged_15_24
label: Immigrant youth
definition: Percentage of the population aged 15-24 that is foreign born
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Target Group Profile; 2011 Census Cat. no. 98-311-XCB2011023, 98-311-XCB2011019

name: low_wage_employment_25plus
label: Low-wage employment
definition: Percentage of the employed labour force aged 25+ working in retail trade and accommodation and food services
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Custom Tabulation

name: visible_minority
label: Visible minority population
definition: Percentage of the population that is a visible minority
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Cat. no. 99-004-XWE

name: modest_income
label: Modest income population
definition: Percentage of the population with income greater than the after-tax Low-income measure LIM-AT, but below the 30th income percentile
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Cat. no. 99-004-XWE

name: lone_parent
label: Lone Parent Households
definition: Lone parent families as a percentage of all families
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Cat. no. 99-004-XWE

name: avg_after-tax_income_25plus
label: Average after-tax income, population aged 25+
definition: Average after-tax income for the population aged 25+
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Cat. no. 99-014-x2011040

name: low_income_15-24
label: Youth Low Income (15-24)
definition: Percentage of the population aged 15-24 with income below the after-tax Low-income measure (LIM-AT)
source: Statistics Canada: 2011 National Household Survey Custom Tabulation

name: take_up_rate
label: Canada Learning Bond Take-Up 2015
definition: The CLB take-up rate is a ratio between the number of CLB beneficiaries and eligible children. It is the number of children who have ever received a CLB, expressed as a percentage of the total number of children eligible for the bond, as of a given year
source: Employment and Social Development Canada, 2015
